post.body: I had the same experience recently, but in retrospect I probably shouldn't have told them what I was thinking.
Big news - good luck with the new gig!
Your mom sounds cool.
There's a curmudgeon position that corks are required for proper oxygenation during aging, but I say drink that shit already.
You're a smarter man than I.
Stay alive, no matter what occurs. I will find you.
Thanks for having us, it was a lot of fun!
But first, it's COD thirty.
Hey, I just changed the color of my site for the first time since 2003. Baby steps.
That's funny, I want a font anti-aliasing option in Photoshop called "Make it goddamned look like Safari already".
I've wished for the same thing myself. Seems like it would be pretty complicated to parse for that though.
It's like my very own personal threat advisory level.
That's why we have a constitution that's based on the assumption that humans are none of those things.
You're never going to get a date with that cynical bastard attitude.
I have a longstanding distrust for movies that rely on the premise that Glenn Close is attractive.
Yes, buy 10.
I just guessed and rounded up. :)
It all becomes clear.
Drove home from Sonoma with @trammel to skip outlet shopping with @lbm and @j, but forgot I left my key with the neighbor. Stuck outside.
Still recovering from a Thanksgiving dinner to rival the best in my career. Thanks @lbm and @j!
Not especially excited about getting on the road with all this traffic, but vacations gotta start sometime.
Sometimes design is like archaeology. When you hit the right solution, it feels like you're uncovering something that's always been there.
I didn't think it was possible, but the gradient tool in Illustrator has actually gotten worse in CS4.
Fellow SF folks, we just vastly improved the crime data on sf.everyblock.com with this new police calls data: http://tr.im/1hrj
Long-term investing is a lot easier now that a good investment amounts to: "Is this company going to be around in 10 years?"
Facebook trying to buy Twitter with stock is like proposing to somebody by promising to have sex with them someday if you feel like it.
My cat only sits in my lap when I'm at my computer. She's such a slavedriver.
I'm proud of how this change to EveryBlock turned out. Adrian does a great job of describing the value. http://tr.im/1dhw
Just donated to @trammell for Movember on his birthday. Now you go: http://tr.im/1bfo
Unfortunately not: Moonlighting, Scarecrow & Mrs. King, Mork & Mindy, Golden Girls or Small Wonder.
Fully realizes the irony of his last statement.
Realizing it's been a while since I commented on a site. I think I'm getting less willing to express my half-formed opinions in public.
Experimenting with colors other than green. Feels like cheating: http://tr.im/1svc
I hate it when apps suddenly make me relearn keyboard shortcut muscle memory. I'm looking at you, TextMate.
Really enjoying the media center software race. Between @boxee, Xbox 360, Plex and the Sapphire Front Row plugin, lots of toys.
Removed the text-shadow Safari anti-aliasing hack on my site because I finally realized that it bugs me on every site where I see it.
I just cried at a TV show after one episode. This is ridiculous.
I'm 20 minutes into the pilot of Friday Night Lights and I can't believe how good this show is.
OH: What if ninjas delivered you barbecue?
Good night for Christmas parties. Great dinner with the EveryBlock crew and their ladies. Also, donuts for dessert two nights in a row.
Valkyrie was better than I expected. Fascinating story at least. http://tr.im/2olf
Getting up at 5am on Christmas used to be a lot more fun, as I remember.
2GB of RAM for my 17" MacBook Pro from crucial.com in 2008: $20. Same amount of memory for my 15" MBP 3 years ago: $200.
Um, why didn't anybody tell me you could get 2GB of RAM for $20?
It's that time of year again, favorite jeans just ripped.
Second fraudulent charge on my Citi credit card in 3 months. This time for $3000 at nflshop.com. I wonder if I can ask to see the order.
